Lufkin City Council

Mayor Mark Hicks
Mayor Mark Hicks (936) 633-0299 mhicks@cityoflufkin.com

Mark Hicks was sworn in as Mayor of the City of Lufkin on May 15, 2021. A fifth-generation Lufkinite, Mayor Hicks has deep roots in both Lufkin and Angelina County. He is a graduate of Lufkin High School and holds a Bachelor of Arts from Stephen F. Austin State University. He and his wife, Callie, are the proud parents of three daughters—Caroline, Macy, and Aniston—who keep life meaningful and lively at home.

As a real estate developer, Mayor Hicks has long been dedicated to revitalizing Lufkin’s historic charm. His work breathing new life into Downtown Lufkin earned him the Golden Anvil Award in 2011, reflecting his early commitment to preserving the community’s character while encouraging thoughtful progress.

Since taking office, Mayor Hicks has been a steadfast champion for growth and opportunity in Lufkin. He has worked to strengthen economic development partnerships, support local businesses, and encourage strategic investment that benefits families, employers, and future generations. His leadership is guided by a belief that Lufkin’s best days are ahead—and that growth should honor the city’s history while creating a vibrant, sustainable future.

In addition to his role as mayor, he serves on the Board of Directors for Lufkin’s 4-B Economic Development,  Hotel Tax Funding Board, and the City of Lufkin Finance Committee. Mayor Hicks served as the previous chairman of the Women’s Shelter of East Texas and the Angelina County United Way. He and his family are active members of Harmony Hill Baptist Church.

Mayor Hicks remains committed to fostering a strong, connected, and forward-looking Lufkin—one where community pride and continued progress go hand in hand.

Angela Hobbs-Spencer
Angela Hobbs-Spencer Councilmember Ward 1 ahobbs-spencer@cityoflufkin.com A Native of East Texas, Angela Hobbs Spencer is the daughter of the late Earl and Lilie Bell (Harris) Hobbs of Lufkin, Texas. A 1986 Graduate of Lufkin High School and a 1989 Graduate of Sam Houston State University with a Bachelor Arts Degree in Criminology and Corrections with an emphasis on Psychology and Sociology. Ms. Hobbs Spencer began her career in the field of employment with Angelina County Juvenile Probation and Angelina County Adult Probation in 1989. In 1990, she continued with her career path and began employment with Harris County Supervision and Corrections Department in Houston Texas as a Certified Texas Adult Probation Agent. In 1994, Ms. Hobbs-Spencer, married and relocated to the East Coast. While in the State of Maryland, Ms. Hobbs-Spencer gained and maintained stable employment with the Frederick County Government until her retirement in 2021. While in Maryland, community engagement was an enormous part of Ms. Hobbs-Spencer daily life. From serving on local, state and federal related commissions and boards, to working with non profit agencies;  she brings to Lufkin a plethora of years of experience in the corporate, government and non profit arenas. Being honored and recognized as a recipient for  “The Harry S. Denman Evangelism Award”, “The Frederick County Human Relations Hall of Fame Award”, “Top 100 Woman of Maryland award”, “The Citizens Award from the Frederick City Police”, ”The Maryland Police and Training Academy  Instructor of the Year for the State of Maryland”,  “The Frederick County Woman of Excellence and Leadership Award”, “The State of Maryland’s Harriet Tubman Trailblazer Award” and the “The President of the United States Lifetime Achievement Award from UNESCO” and many other accolades are only a few of the acknowledgements received while residing on the East Coast. Since retiring from Government employment and returning to Texas, Ms. Hobbs-Spencer, continues to serve our community. She is a Board Certified Clinical Chaplain and Pastoral Counselor and volunteers with St Lukes Health.  She serves on the Planning and Zoning Commission for the City of Lufkin. She is 2024 Graduate of the Lufkin Angelina County Chamber of Commerce Leadership Lufkin class 41. An active member of the Lufkin Area Chapter of Top Ladies of Distinction. She serves as the current Chaplain of the Lufkin Area Alumnae Chapter of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority Incorporated. She serves as the National Day of Prayer coordinator for the National Day of Prayer Task Force and active member of the Lufkin Interdenominational Ministerial Alliance. This Summer, Ms. Hobbs Spencer will complete the Leading Edge program, also hosted by the Lufkin Angelina County Chamber of Commerce. Ms. Hobbs Spencer returned to her home church, Goodwill Missionary Baptist Church, now (Goodwill Church Lufkin) and serves as the “the  Senior ministry coordinator for those  members who are 70 and older. Her personal mantra reflects her character and her purposeful mission of life; she will tell you that “She is Empowered for Excellence and Destined to Be the Difference.” Ms. Hobbs-Spencer, lives, works, worships, and serves faithfully in her community. In her spare time, Ms. Hobbs-Spencer can be found shopping, traveling or spending quality time with family and friends.
Robert Shankle
Robert Shankle Councilmember Ward 2 (936) 635-8195 rshankle@cityoflufkin.com Councilman Robert Shankle was elected to Lufkin City Council as Councilmember of Ward 2 on May 9, 2009. Councilman Shankle is a lifelong resident of Lufkin Texas. He received his education in the Lufkin Independent School and graduated from Lufkin High School in the Class of 1985. Also, a Leadership Lufkin Graduate of 2012. A Desert Storm disabled veteran, Councilman Shankle served in the United States Army, National Guard, and US Army Reserve for a total of 14 years. He founded several committees for the benefit of the community including The Lufkin Pro Day Group, The Neighborhood Leadership Council of North Lufkin, and Clergy and Police Alliance (CAPA). Councilman Shankle is a member of Texas Association of Black City Council Members and National Black Caucus of Local Elected Officials. Councilman Shankle is a proud member of The Church by Christ Jesus where he is very active. His favorite quote is “To whom much is given, much is required.”
Kimberly Abeldt
Kimberly Abeldt Councilmember Ward 3 kabeldt@cityoflufkin.com

Kimberly Abeldt was elected to serve as Council Member to Ward 3 in November, 2025. Mrs. Abeldt has been a business owner for over 25 years. Within pharmacy ownership, Kimberly has overseen compliance to pharmacy oversight agencies, contracted employee benefits, beneficiary contracts as well as testifying to the Department of Defense to insure that veterans maintain their right to choose their pharmacy and to receive the pharmaceutical & medical device services they need as life brings about new challenges. By answering to 17 government agencies and employing on average 60 full-time employees with benefits, Kimberly has a unique understanding of long range strategic planning, budgeting, sustainable growth, and the importance to policy and procedures that both protect and propel community opportunities. Prior to marrying Jeffrey Abeldt in 1996, Kimberly worked for the largest awards manufacturer in the world as their Lead Procurement Officer for 6 years.. She oversaw the purchasing of materials for the production of plaques, medals, bronze statues and other awards. She oversaw contracting with vendors for large accounts such as the USA Olympics & Special Olympics. Such contracts required culminating community & historic data for venue placement and product selection. This experience establishes unprecedented awareness of not just gaining insight from data but knowing how to implement the data for the good of the community. Kimberly has worked in philanthropy her entire adult life. She has served within and alongside agencies such as The American Cancer Society, CASA, Family Assistance Centers, County Natural Disaster Support Teams and helped to bring a college of pharmacy to East Texas. For 13 years Kimberly taught the youth of her church and opened her home for a ladies Bible study each week. She now worships with her husband at First Baptist Church, Lufkin. Kimberly has a clear passion for investing in her community, serving people of all backgrounds and igniting a renewed pride for all that Lufkin is and has yet to become.

Kim Ogden
Kim Ogden Councilmember Ward 4 kogden@cityoflufkin.com Kim Ogden was elected as Ward No. 4 Councilwoman in May 2024.
Jimmy Ford
Jimmy Ford Councilmember Ward 5 jford@cityoflufkin.com Jimmy Ford was elected to City Council in February 2024.

Jimmy was raised in Lufkin and is a 1977 graduate of Lufkin High School. While in high school and college, he worked at Roland’s Tackle Shop. Upon his graduation from Stephen F. Austin State University in 1980, he began his career at Axley & Rode, CPAs. He retired as a CPA tax partner in 2019.

Jimmy is married to Kelley Jeffrey Ford, who is employed with The Advanced Financial Group. They have two adult children, Julianne and Parker, who both grew up in Lufkin.

He has been involved with various local organizations over the past 40 years and currently serves as the chaplain for the Lufkin Host (Noon) Lions Club and treasurer of the Z&OO Railroad.

Adam Lowther
Adam Lowther Councilmember Ward 6 936-676-8446 alowther@cityoflufkin.com Adam Lowther was elected to the City Council for Ward 6 in May 2023.
He works as a Senior Project Buyer for Corrigan OSB, an oriented strand board mill in Corrigan, TX. Mr. Lowther previously held Marketing and Supply Chain roles at Brookshire Brothers. He and his wife, Chandler, have been married since 2016 after meeting at Texas A&M. They have a son, Wesley, who was born in May 2022.
Mr. Lowther said he ran for Lufkin City Council because he wanted to help improve the city for his son and future generations. "We have a lot of great things happening in our city and we need leaders in place to continue guiding us into the future."
